author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations Security Council approved a resolution backing President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan, in a move the US said would help bolster the fragile truce between Israel and Hamas.
title: UN Security Council Backs Trump’s Bid for Gaza Stabilization Force

author: Nathan R Dean
description: It’s the season for dealmaking in Washington.
title: What’s Next for Obamacare, Saudis Investments and Russian Sanctions

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump signaled a willingness to expand his military campaign in Latin America to include possible strikes in Venezuela, Colombia and Mexico as he complained about the flow of drugs and migrants into the US.
title: Trump Airs Frustration With Latin America as Forces Assemble

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Senate Commerce Committee has opened an investigation of alleged corruption in Major League Baseball as the sport confronts a gambling scandal.
title: Senate Panel Launches Probe of Gambling in Major League Baseball

author: Josh Sisco
description: Melissa Holyoak, one of three commissioners on the Federal Trade Commission, is stepping down from her post Monday following her appointment as interim US Attorney for the District of Utah, according to a statement from the FTC.
title: FTC’s Holyoak Departs to Become Interim US Attorney in Utah

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump said he would approve the sale of F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia when he meets Tuesday with the kingdom’s crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman.
title: Trump Says US Plans to Sell F-35 Jets to Saudi Arabia

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook’s legal team offered a detailed rebuttal to mortgage fraud allegations made by President Donald Trump and other US officials, arguing in a new letter to Attorney General Pam Bondi that the claims “fail on even the most cursory look at the facts.”
title: Fed’s Lisa Cook Contests ‘Baseless’ Mortgage Fraud Case to Bondi

author: Erin Ailworth, Michael Hirtzer
description: Soybean futures jumped on signals that  China is stepping up buying of the oilseed, offering hope for US farmers after purchases appeared to have stalled.
title: Soybean Futures Rebound on Signs China Is Ramping Up Purchases

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. continued his campaign against the aluminum in some vaccines by suggesting at a conference on Monday that they may play a role in the rise of food allergies.
title: RFK Jr. Tries to Tie Aluminum in Vaccines to Food Allergies

author: Zahra Hirji, Lauren Rosenthal
description: The Trump administration’s top official at the Federal Emergency Management Agency is departing his post after about six months on the job, according to the Washington Post.
title: Trump’s FEMA Chief Resigns After 6 Months, Washington Post Says

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Long-stalled legislation to impose sanctions on countries that do business with Russia may soon get a vote in the US Senate after President Donald Trump told reporters on Sunday that he’s “OK” with it, Senator Lindsey Graham said.
title: Trump ‘OK’ May Clear Way for Russia Sanctions Bill, Graham Says

author: Emily Birnbaum, Oma Seddiq
description: Democratic Senator Mark Warner predicted rapidly advancing artificial intelligence threatens to drive up the unemployment rate of recent college graduates to as much as 25% within the next two to three years.
title: AI Risks Leaving 25% of New College Grads Jobless, Senator Says

author: Liam Knox
description: The US academic year is well underway. With students back in labs and lecture halls, they might notice more empty seats than usual — especially at schools and in programs that enroll large numbers of international scholars.
title: Foreign Student Enrollment Is Down 17% Under Trump. What It Means for Universities

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Justice Department’s indictment of James Comey was riddled with problems that may give the former FBI director legal grounds to have it dismissed, a federal judge ruled on Monday.
title: Judge Finds ‘Profound’ Missteps in DOJ’s Indictment of Comey

author: Nicholas Comfort
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz joined European politicians in saying the bloc’s banking regulations are too strict as the US gives lenders an easier ride to free up financing for the economy.
title: Germany’s Merz Says European Banking Rules Are ‘Too Rigorous’

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa is investigating a flight that brought Palestinians to Johannesburg last week, describing it as suspicious and part of a wider effort to “cleanse” them from Gaza and the West Bank.
title: South Africa Warns of Bid to ‘Cleanse’ Palestinians From Gaza

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s next president will have to navigate a split Congress and broker deals to push forward legislation after neither the right nor the left secured a majority in Sunday’s election.
title: Chile’s Next President Will Face Resistance in Divided Congress

author: Carolina Millan
description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum called for an investigation into clashes with police during a large weekend protest in the capital, arguing that the anti-government demonstration was co-opted by violent groups.
title: Sheinbaum Calls for Probe Into Violence During Capital Protest

author: S'thembile Cele, Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa is “forging ahead” with negotiations on adopting a leaders’ declaration at the Group of 20 summit this weekend, the nation’s foreign minister said.
title: South Africa Pushes for G-20 Declaration Despite US No-Show

author: Natasha Voase
description: Political uncertainty is making it impossible to invest in the UK’s commercial real estate market, according to the boss of FTSE 250 landlord Sirius Real Estate.
title: Political Doubts Make UK Property Uninvestible, Sirius CEO Says

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuador bonds fell after voters delivered a sharp and surprising repudiation of President Daniel Noboa’s attempt to consolidate power, defying the polls and rejecting his proposals for constitutional reform.
title: Ecuador Bonds Drop on Surprise Noboa Referendum Defeat

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: European Union officials are concerned a US push to expand the list of EU products subject to higher steel and aluminum tariffs may run afoul of the spirit of the trade agreement they signed this summer.
title: EU to Warn Lutnick Against Expanding Scope of US Steel Tariffs

author: Chris Palmeri
description: Resorts World, one of three bidders for a casino license in the greater New York City area, will ask the state to reconsider the company’s tax proposal after offering to pay far more than two other possible projects, a person with knowledge of the matter matter said.
title: Resorts World to Ask NY to Reconsider Casino Tax Rates After Bid

author: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz rejected speculation that he could abandon his ruling coalition with the Social Democrats and lead a minority government, vowing to stick with the alliance despite persistent tensions.
title: Merz Rules Out Minority Government as Coalition Strain Persists

author: Colum Murphy, Alastair Gale, Jing Li
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is facing her first major diplomatic test less than a month into office, after angering China with remarks about Tokyo’s position on the red line issue of Taiwan.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Has Few Good Options to End China’s Retaliation

author: Colum Murphy
description: New premier Takaichi has stoked fresh tensions with Beijing with her recent remarks on Taiwan.
title: Japan-China Ties Are Spiraling Toward a Crisis

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union has proposed funding Ukraine with either a €90 billion ($104 billion) grant or an EU debt-backed loan if countries can’t approve a preferred plan to use frozen Russian assets.
title: EU Pitches €90 Billion Ukraine Grant if Russian Asset Loan Fails

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The redeployments come amid signs of impatience inside the Trump administration.
title: Coast Guard Patrols Rio Grande While Border Agents Hit US Cities

author: Hatem Mohareb, Salma El Wardany
description: The son of deposed Libyan leader Muammar Qaddafi freed in Lebanon after a decade behind bars is now seeking to travel to South Africa, according to a spokeswoman.
title: Qaddafi Son Freed by Lebanon Now Seeks to Travel to South Africa

author: James Regan
description: Ukraine has signed a letter of intent to buy as many as 100 Rafale fighter jets, built by Dassault Aviation SA, Agence France-Presse reported, citing French President Emmanuel Macron’s office.
title: Ukraine Commits to Buying up to 100  Rafale Fighters

author: Srinivasan Sivabalan, Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s stocks and currency, which rallied through the war in Gaza, are extending gains after the ceasefire as investors bet stability will unlock a wave of foreign capital and export growth.
title: Israeli Markets’ Wartime Rally Gives Way to Peace-Time Boom

author: Manolo Serapio Jr, Ditas B Lopez
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has revamped his Cabinet after key resignations following a monthslong corruption scandal involving flood-control projects that continue to grip the nation.
title: Marcos Names Frederick Go as Finance Secretary in Revamped Philippine Cabinet

author: Kanoko Matsuyama, Daniela Wei, Danny Lee
description: Even as China’s travel warning to Japan after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s Taiwan comments deepens a diplomatic rift, many ordinary Chinese are keeping their plans to visit this season’s hottest overseas destination.
title: Most Chinese Tourists Keep Japan Trips Despite Tensions, For Now

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said an explosion that caused damage to a railway route in the country’s east over the weekend was an act of sabotage.
title: Act of Sabotage Damages Railway Line in East Poland, Tusk Says

author: William Horobin
description: France’s government is meeting with local businesses on Monday to promote investment as the debate over next year’s budget risks delivering a sharp increase in taxation.
title: French Government Touts Investment as Tax Concerns Mount

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korea proposed official military talks with North Korea to reduce tensions along their heavily fortified border in its latest efforts to improve ties with the northern neighbor.
title: South Korea Offers Military Talks With North Over Border Tension

author: Neil Jerome Morales
description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte said President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is facing a “crisis of confidence” amid a deepening corruption scandal as day two of an anti-graft rally drew hundreds of thousands of protesters.
title: Philippines’ VP Duterte Slams Marcos as Anti-Graft Rally Goes On

author: Alastair Gale, Jing Li, Colum Murphy
description: China is escalating its confrontation with Japan over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s comments on Taiwan, with state media threatening major countermeasures after Beijing’s travel warnings raised the specter of economic retribution.
title: China Escalates Japan Spat With Threats of Economic Reprisal

author: Catherine Lucey, Wendy Benjaminson
description: President Donald Trump said Sunday that  House Republicans should vote to require the Justice Department to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein, effectively reversing his position he’d held for months.
title: Trump Flips to Say House Should Vote for Epstein Files Release

author: Arun Devnath, Kai Schultz
description: A special tribunal in Bangladesh sentenced exiled former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to death, finding her guilty of crimes against humanity for her role in violent crackdown of student-led protests last year.
title: Bangladesh’s Former Leader in Exile Hasina Sentenced to Death

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan is set to send a senior diplomat to China in a bid to soothe tensions, public broadcaster NHK reported Monday, after China ratcheted up its response to Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s comments over Taiwan.
title: Japan to Send Senior Diplomat to Soothe China Tensions, NHK Says

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuador’s voters were on course Sunday to deliver a sharp and surprising repudiation of President Daniel Noboa’s attempt to consolidate power, defying the polls and rejecting his proposals for constitutional reform.
title: Ecuador Voters Poised to Deliver Defeat to Noboa in Referendum

author: Daniel Ten Kate, Siddhartha Singh
description: Some three decades ago, when N. Chandrababu Naidu was seeking to turn southern India into a global tech hub, he regularly encountered skepticism from investors.
title: India’s Chief Kingmaker Sees Google Unleashing $1 Trillion Boom

author: Catherine Lucey, Maria Paula Mijares Torres
description: President Donald Trump said proposed Senate legislation to sanction countries conducting business with Russia would be “okay with me,” his strongest indication yet that he would support a monthslong push to strangle Moscow’s funding.
title: Trump Says He’d Back Bill to Sanction Russia’s Trading Partners

author: Irina Anghel
description: Sales of the UK’s most expensive homes plummeted in October, according to new data, with affluent buyers appearing to be put off by the prospect of a so-called mansion tax in Labour’s upcoming budget.
title: Multimillion-Pound Home Sales Drop Sharply Before UK Budget
